p: The study population included Palestinian children and adults from East Jerusalem and the West Bank that suffered mild to severe upper respiratory infection symptoms. Participants were either hospitalized, outpatients, kindergarten children, family members and acquaintance (referred to as private in the manuscript), or visiting a private clinic. Nasopharyngeal aspirate (NPA) were collected using FLOQSwabs TM (#502CS01, Copan Diagnostics Inc., USA).
